title: Clown In A Cornfield 4K Steelbook Blu-Ray Available For Preorder
description: Clown in a Cornfield 4K Steelbook Edition $40 | Release Date: TBA Preorder at Amazon Clown in a Cornfield Blu-ray $26 | Release Date: TBA Preorder Blu-ray at Amazon Preorder DVD at Amazon Released in theaters on May 9, Clown in a Cornfield was a big success for IFC. Grossing nearly $4 million, it set an opening weekend record for the production company, surpassing its previous horror hit, Late Night with the Devil. Despite the niche success, there’s a good chance horror fans missed out on the slasher flick's short theatrical run. Luckily, for those who missed out and fans who want to revisit the movie, preorders are now open for the upcoming Clown in a Cornfield Blu-ray release. Several different formats are up for grabs, including a premium 4K Steelbook Edition Blu-ray--though we’re still waiting on a firm release date. Nevertheless, preordering now locks you in for Amazon's preorder price guarantee, and you won't be charged until your order ships. Clown in a Cornfield 4K Steelbook Edition $40 | Release Date: TBA We’re still waiting for specific details, but we do know that the Clown in a Cornfield 4K Steelbook includes both 4K Blu-ray and standard Blu-ray formats of the film. You’ll also get a few sheets of magnets, featuring Fredo the clown and a bunch of accessories. The main attraction, however, is the steelbook case featuring creepy wrap-around artwork. No bonus materials have been confirmed, but we expect it will likely include the same extra content as the standard Blu-ray that is also available for preorder. Preorder at Amazon Clown in a Cornfield Blu-ray $26 | Release Date: TBA The standard Blu-ray version of the film is quite a bit cheaper than the 4K Steelbook Edition. It also doesn't have a firm release date, we do know it’ll come with a nice bonus feature--commentary from director Eli Craig, author Adam Cesare, and actors Carson MacCormac and Katie Douglas. It's also worth noting that a DVD edition is available for $23 as well, in case you're looking for the most affordable way to own the horror flick on disc. Preorder Blu-ray at Amazon Preorder DVD at Amazon Clown in a Cornfield 4K SteelbookThe Clown in a Cornfield film is based on a series of novels by the same name by Adam Cesare. Most of these are discounted right now, and you’ll find both paperbacks and hardcovers for most of the books. The storyline is chronological, so be sure to start with the original book, Clown in a Cornfield, before moving on to Frendo Lives and The Church of Frendo. A fourth novel is also in the works, making this a good time to catch up on the series.Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Check Out These Awesome Sega Genesis Displays Featuring Sonic, Street Fighter, & More
description: Sonic the Hedgehog 2 Console Heroes Green Hill Zone Cartridge Diorama $20 | Releases July 15 Preorder at Amazon Sonic the Hedgehog 3 Console Heroes Carnival Night Zone Cartridge Diorama $20 | Releases August 2025 Preorder at Amazon Street Fighter 2 Console Heroes Ken Stage Cartridge Diorama $20 | Releases August 2025 Preorder at Amazon Altered Beast Console Heroes Graveyard Cartridge Diorama $20 | Releases August 2025 See at Amazon Sega Genesis Console Heroes Display $50 | Release October 2025 See all Sega Genesis Console Heroes Sets at Amazon If you miss the era of cartridge-based gaming, you'll want to check out Wilder Toys' new line of Console Heroes Sega Genesis Cartridge Dioramas. These miniature displays resemble popular Sega Genesis game cartridges, and unfold to unveil tiny diorama scenes from the games they're inspired by. So far, five Sega Genesis displays have been announced, including sets based on levels from Sonic the Hedgehog 2, Sonic the Hedgehog 3, Super Street Fighter 2, Altered Beast, and a larger set that resembles the Sega Genesis console itself.The cartridge sets are all available to preorder now for $20 each. The Sonic 2 display launches July 15, while the Sonic 3, Altered Beast, and Super Street Fighter 2 sets launch in August. The Sega Genesis console display will be available for $50 later in October, though preorders are not currently available at Amazon. Check out more info on all the Console Heroes Sega Genesis Cartidge Dioramas below. Sonic the Hedgehog 2 Console Heroes Green Hill Zone Cartridge Diorama $20 | Releases July 15 This diorama, based on Sonic the Hedgehog 2's iconic Emerald Hill Zone level, features Sonic and his trusty sidekick, Tails. Preorder at Amazon Sonic the Hedgehog 3 Console Heroes Carnival Night Zone Cartridge Diorama $20 | Releases August 2025 This piece features Sonic and Knuckles the echidna striking familiar poses in a miniaturized scene from Sonic the Hedgehog 3's classic Carnival Night Zone. Preorder at Amazon Street Fighter 2 Console Heroes Ken Stage Cartridge Diorama $20 | Releases August 2025 This display features figures of Ryu and Ken squaring off in a striking recreation of the Super Street Fighter 2's Sega Genesis cartridge art. Preorder at Amazon Altered Beast Console Heroes Graveyard Cartridge Diorama $20 | Releases August 2025 The Altered Beast Console Heroes Cartridge Diorama recreates the infamous graveyard stage from the beginning of the game. It includes figures of the resurrected Roman Centurion in his werewolf form and the Aggar boss monster. See at Amazon Sega Genesis Console Heroes Display $50 | Release October 2025 The Sega Genesis Console Heroes Display includes a fold-out Diorama based on the console, plus a cartridge storage tray for storing other Console Heroes dioramas (or even real Genesis carts), plus four figures, including:Super Sonic figureMech Suit Robotnik figureDeath Bringer figureMr. X figureWhile final images have not been revealed, several photos of the set have surfaced online, and it looks to be a much bigger that the cartridge dioramas. Preorders are not yet available at Amazon, but we expect it'll show up ahead of its October 2025 release, so keep checking the retailer's listings. See all Sega Genesis Console Heroes Sets at Amazon More Gaming, Tech, and Entertainment Deals & Preorders 8BitDo's New $50 iPhone Controller Is Officially Licensed By Xbox Superman 4K Blu-Ray Steelbook Edition Is Up For Preorder At Amazon This Nintendo Switch 2 Handheld Controller Is Only $50 For A Limited Time + Show More More Gaming, Tech, and Entertainment Deals & Preorders Links (3) The Criterion Collection 50% Off Movie Sale - Here Are The Best Deals All Four Discontinued Donkey Kong Lego Sets Restocked At Amazon Donkey Kong Bananza Game & Amiibo Bundle Available At Walmart

title: You Probably Won't Survive In Dune: Awakening If You Don't Pay Your Taxes
description: It often feels like the entire world around you is conspiring to bring about your demise. On Arrakis, that’s true. Between the sandworms and the other deadly players, you’d be hard pressed to find anyone or anything friendly. Even worse, your only haven—the base you build—isn’t free or safe. You owe money to the local…Read more...

title: There's a bunch of discounted AMD and Nvidia graphics cards now up to 50% off at Amazon today
description: I spent a good chunk of my weekend combing through GPU deals like these. I don't really need a new graphics card, but seeing prices drop by almost half gets my curiosity going. It’s not even just the big names like the RTX 5090 or the Radeon RX 7900 XT, even refurbished cards look tempting when they’re going for hundreds less. I know some folks hesitate with renewed products, but I’ve had solid luck so far. Last year, I grabbed a renewed RTX 4070 super and it’s been running steady since. I guess it’s that mix of curiosity and trying not to miss out that keeps me scrolling through these lists. Here's the best deals I can find for your latest rig upgrade: Read more
author: Christian Wait

title: Sundays With Tabs the Cat, Makeup and Beauty Blog Mascot, Vol. 866
description: Rosie should have known better than to trust Marnie with Rosie’s investments. After all, Marnie doesn’t have any background or credentials or expertise in financial planning. There was no reason to think Marnie would be able to manage Rosie’s assets, but Rosie wanted to give her a chance. Oh, well. Bad move on Rosie’s part. Even someone of Rosie’s intellectual stature screws up sometimes. Sure, she may understand quantum physics better than any other cat on the planet, but that doesn’t mean she understands compound interest. Sigh… Now Rosie has to think of a way of to recoup all those losses. Hmm… What could she invent? I’m sure she’ll think of something. 🐱 Your friendly neighborhood beauty addict, Karen The post Sundays With Tabs the Cat, Makeup and Beauty Blog Mascot, Vol. 866 appeared first on Makeup and Beauty Blog | Makeup Reviews, Swatches and How-To Makeup.
author: Karen

title: Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 885
description: So…what is the Monday Poll? Excellent question! It isn’t, contrary to its name, an actual poll, like with little clicky buttons. It’s just a list of more or less random questions I’ve been posting on this blog every Monday morning for the past quadrillion years (since 2007). 1. Do you keep backups of your favorite products? These days, the only backups I buy are things I know I’ll finish on a regular basis (like shampoo and conditioner, or body lotion). I don’t even bother with makeup backups anymore, though. If I finish something like a blush or an eyebrow pencil, great, and if it’s still around when it’s time to restock, that’s even better. If it’s discontinued, I might mourn it a little bit, but there’s always something new coming out, and I don’t mind trying new things, so I don’t stress about it too much. 2. Something that you read/watched/listened to recently that was surprisingly great? I watched “KPop Demon Hunters” on Netflix with Connor over the weekend, and I was surprised to enjoy[Continue reading...] The post Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 885 appeared first on Makeup and Beauty Blog | Makeup Reviews, Swatches and How-To Makeup.
